Subject: 4play-1.1 released (4 card puzzle)
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=104426122
X-Yahoo-Profile: zenguyuno

4play-1.1 was just released.  I made it run faster, I
included a WhatsNew.txt file and a results.txt file,
and shorter perfect player chromosomes.  The smallest
one has only 34 neurons.  Also, a program to examine
and report about a chromosome is included.  With it I
discovered that well over half of the weights and
biases for the 4Play perfect chromosomes, are
unecessary! There are several unecesary neurons also! 
However, my current methods don't result in ANNs like
those.  I'll bet NEAT could evolve a perfect player
with only 20 neurons!  (That's assuming binary neurons
which have only 1-bit of memory capacity.) 
Theoretically, neurons with continuous output have
much higher memory capacity; but its not clear if that
would be applicable to this problem.

=====
Mitchell Timin
http://annevolve.sourceforge.net
